items.title: Despite Trump’s Pressure on Justice Dept., Certain Safeguards Are Beyond His Reach
items.summary: The criminal justice system has protections that could ultimately give pause to some of President Trump’s moves for revenge.

items.title: Elk Hunters Found Dead at San Juan Forest Had Been Struck by Lightning
items.summary: The two men were found last week after a search operation in the San Juan National Forest that involved hundreds on foot or on horseback and was supported by drones and helicopters.

items.title: Drone Strike in Haiti Kills 8 Children at a Birthday Party
items.summary: A drone meant to strike a gang leader hit a celebration where children had gathered. Haiti is using drones to repel gangs that control much of the capital.

items.title: Jury Finds Ryan Routh Guilty of Trying to Assassinate Trump in Florida
items.summary: A federal jury found Ryan Routh, an itinerant building contractor, guilty of attempting to assassinate a major presidential candidate last September.

items.title: The Rapture Was Predicted to Happen Today. TikTok Has Some Advice.
items.summary: There are thousands of videos to help prepare those who may or may not ascend into the heavens on Tuesday.

items.title: Trump Cancels Meeting With Democrats as Government Shutdown Nears
items.summary: Top Democrats are demanding concessions on health care in exchange for their support on a bill to fund the government. Mr. Trump called the demands “unserious.”

items.title: Trump says Nato countries should shoot down Russian aircraft entering their airspace – US politics live
items.summary: <p>US president’s comments come after series of drone incursions by Russian fighter jets; Trump also scolds European countries over migration </p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/23/trump-un-general-assembly-speech">Trump calls for nations to close borders and expel foreigners in UN speech: ‘Your countries are being ruined’</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/23/trump-un-speech-fact-check-claims">Fact-check: Trump’s false and misleading claims during his UN address</a></p></li></ul><p>While the Secret Service hasn’t confirmed that the telecommunications threat was targeting the United Nations general assembly, the agency said that the devices were “concentrated within 35 miles of the global meeting” and the investigation is ongoing.</p><p>The Secret Service added that early forensic analysis of the deviced indicates “cellular communications between nation-state threat actors and individuals that are known to federal law enforcement”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/23/donald-trump-unga-autism-tylenol-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump to hold one-to-one meeting in Washington on 20 October
items.summary: <p>After being left off the US president’s schedule in New York, the prime minister will travel to the US again next month</p><ul><li><p><strong>Get our </strong><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/email-newsletters?CMP=cvau_sfl"><strong>breaking news email</strong></a><strong>, </strong><a href="https://app.adjust.com/w4u7jx3"><strong>free app</strong></a><strong> or </strong><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/series/full-story?CMP=cvau_sfl"><strong>daily news podcast</strong></a></p></li></ul><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/sep/21/republicans-warn-australia-of-punitive-measures-over-recognition-of-palestinian-state">Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump</a> will hold their first face-to-face meeting in Washington DC, next month.</p><p>The stand-alone meeting has been set for 20 October, the White House confirmed. It will be the third time in six months the prime minister has travelled to the United States.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/23/donald-trump-dismisses-australias-recognition-of-palestinian-state-in-fiery-un-speech">Continue reading...</a>
